pullRequest.title: Make summary available for instructors
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


The instructor could not view the whole summary of a student exam
Description

Added a new page where the instructor can view a student exam
Steps for Testing


Log in to Artemis
Navigate to the exam view of a instructor
Open a student exam
Click on summary
Check that the summary is displayed correctly

Screenshots

nodes.bodyText: Might want to declare List<Exercise> exercises = studentExam.getExercises() here to avoid multiple database accesses fetching the list several times (lines 77, 78, 83, 90, 93) if that is not specifically intended

If I see this correctly, some of this code is duplicated.
I suggest that you try to extract methods for the duplicated parts

commit.message:
Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into exam/manage/summary

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/webapp/app/exam/manage/exam-management.route.ts

small code improvements

isAtLeastInstructor is already available in the course

fix some issues in the summary and in student details view

mostly type script errors
programming summary does not need a submission
added some additional checks in case the submission is not available

nodes.bodyText: The button will be displayed next to the save button of the working time edit form. I think this is confusing for the user. I would move it next to the page title.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,13 +43,20 @@
- +
+
Student Summary
+ +
+

nodes.bodyText: Also remove the import to prevent warnings

I think it would be better to return directly when an accessFailure occurs. This makes sense not only with regard to the procedure, but also because the access service checks whether the studentExam exists at all.
